text: street art's cool but don't erase history – it inspires us too
cool historic vibes but feels overcrowded tbh
those tiny spaces really define our cityscape!
artisanal soaps? miss browsing those old comics tbh
yeah but when every corner turns hipster gourmet you kinda miss just grabbing a simple snack 😒 where'd all the local spots go?
saw an old-school arcade turned coffee shop with retro games still playable... got our history brewed right into today's latte scene 🕹️ nothing stays same huh
burnout's real; finding hobbies outside work helps break monotony though
historical charm overrated when broke
gotta hustle harder than heritage vibes
def some places by central station give off weird vibes at night
stories always got their way into designing cool stuff here – spooky legend themed events pop up sometimes 'round haloween especially near "haunted" spots 😅 talk bout life imitating art!
cycle thief ghost stories are legit everywhere here
spooky canal stories here too 😬 steer clear after dark!
crazy seeing our chill spots turn techy huh
yeah saw something like that done where i hung out too – skate park's now this sleek plaza smh feels like they hit refresh on all our memories
weekends are now for cozy design seshs at home!
totally get you - it's all netflix & doodles for me lately; feels good not draining your wallet every weekend
found some rad spots by canals where u can chill & sketch with friends - low spend & loads of inspo!
found an old-school arcade tucked away in an alley - retro heaven 👾
design inspo everywhere in those small art galleries dotting back streets - always leave with new ideas buzzing
yeah gentrification’s a beast but it's dope finding gems that survive it all – makes those spots extra special
growth matters but also staying true stings less than conformity
just feels like settling down too early sometimes - shouldn’t we be pushing boundaries instead? why not balance both worlds?
scheduling? kinda feels overrated tbh
bills paid on time hits different
meal planning saves so much stress
uhh neat but isn't cooking kind of expected? i'm hyped because i managed to budget tight enough for next month’s rent - big deal when every euro counts!
everyone hyped up hitting those big milestone ages but honestly? just feels like extra stress nobody needs 🎯 pressures off when you ditch those deadlines anyhow
lol career by 25? who does that anymore 😂
milestones' timeline? lol just pressure traps
dream salary? more like fantasy league stuff tbh
kinda mastered fixing up bikes outta necessity but honestly it’s pretty chill - feels good saving some cash & solving puzzles at once
moved out for college - felt independent real quick!
dreams got bills now lol
spreadsheets don't cover sneaker lust 😂😅
designer’s hustle ≠ comfy excel sheets
dreamlife’s pricey here - gotta improvise daily!
managing money can get tricky with erratic gigs, but i swear by budget apps & setting aside emergency funds when times are good... anyone else got lifelines they stick to?
always got an eye out for freelance gigs - gotta stay agile!
peers' paychecks ≠ personal peace 🚫💸✌️
hustle + creativity > just stacking euros

kinda wild how we sketch out our lives thinking one thing then end up painting totally new pictures – i'm halfway through design school yet already freelancing like crazy, guess life doesn’t stick strictly to the storyboard 🎨💼
still studying but freelancing as graphic designer on side
gotta hustle alongside those lectures for real success

studying for something creative like graphic design can feel super open-ended – you think it's all gonna be art & ideas till client briefs hit u with a reality check 😅 real-world work really throws theory outta the window sometimes
still wondering why kerning isn't paying off bills
still figuring it out tbh, design's cool but who knows 🤷‍♂️
not all about cash tbh - sometimes you're stuck with stacks but zero passion for what you do every day 😕
had to color match with markers once cuz printer died mid-presentation
hadta fix a logo vector once mid-presentation using only ms paint 'cause illustrator crashed - felt like digital age Picasso lol
nice one with the risotto but wondering if you ever tried taking your 'art' outta kitchen? always thought creations need bigger audience than just taste buds - they gotta spark ideas imo 🤔
totally get you, pouring hours into designs barely noticed really hits hard
sometimes creativity feels like an endless grind too
never planned on design here either but creativity beats monotony anyday
it's kinda like improv - making it up as you go can lead to awesome stuff
color theory literally colors my world view now...oops
Every swipe feels like you're just hopin' your meme game aligns or that they're into indie bands over top 40 - so many unique vibes trying to click!
profiles are game-changers too imo
highlight reels def make things seem uneven but don't forget guys do get right swipes when they nail their profile game - skills over luck i say 🤷‍♂️
studying design didn't really feel like a "gendered" choice
not always so cut n dry imo
yeah seems more about personal interest than anything else
society's expectations are overrated - express urself through art!
money talks sure but don't forget plenty artists out there making ends meet without sacrificing their vibes 🎨 hustling finds its way!
design "soft skill" stereotype? nah mate crafts require killer tech skills too
ever noticed not many dudes at yoga classes? decided to give it a shot - flexibility’s no joke! kindda cool being the odd one out occasionally
house chores were always framed as 'everyone's job' growing up so this whole gender role thing feels so outdated tbh
tough balance for sure! props for juggling both worlds 😓
turning 30? just feels same like any other day tbh
graphic design feels pretty flexible gender-wise tbh
feels like picking up old hobbies could just be dodging boredom or loneliness tbh... why not mix it up? find new passions AND meet new peeps – balance is key 🗝️
still kinda miss deep connections tho
still think ppl use "freedom" as an excuse sometimes tbh
staying single’s cool but all work no play? sounds dull tbh
relationships don't dictate your hobby choices imo
not much changed for me tbh – still crushing design concepts between reddit deep dives 🎨 no SO means no new salsa skills though lol
total freedom but sometimes wish for more tbh
spending lots of time freelancing definitely fills up your calendar, but you can't shake off feeling like you're missing out on some duo adventures sometimes 🤷‍♂️
personal interests + internet mix things up too
definitely feel those vibes – like mixing colors on canvas but you choose the picture you paint 😄
nv really felt attached, too much going on
managing day-to-day stuff has turned into planning around off-peak hours with all these folks flockin' over 😑 adaptability level up!

totally see where you're coming from! places getting hype usually means more cool stuff around but then again those hidden spots aren't so hidden anymore...always bittersweet when your secret chill spots turn into tourist hotspots 🤷‍♂️
feels like watching an indie band go mainstream sometimes
not everyone feels their birthplace defines them - some peeps just don't resonate 🤷‍♂️
experiences shape peeps more than cities do tbh
ehh feels overrated tbh
sure some folks feel a strong sense of place but personally it's more 'bout where you're heading than where ya started 🤔
